docs.lead_paragraph: Jeff Teague sank two free throws that gave Atlanta the lead with less than two minutes left, and Paul Millsap had season highs with 34 points and 15 rebounds.
docs.abstract: NBA Roundup; Paul Millsap has season highs with 34 points and 15 rebounds as Atlanta Hawks win, 92-91, over Boston Celtics; other basketball news noted.

docs.abstract: Brooklyn Nets, who are suffering from many different problems after falling out of last season's playoffs and being overhauled, end bad year with 113-92 loss to San Antonio Spurs.

docs.snippet: In the misty mountain strongholds of the southern Mexico state of Chiapas, ski mask-clad members and supporters of the Zapatista rebel movement gathered to mark the 20th anniversary of a New Year's uprising that wrenched the world's attention to t...
docs.lead_paragraph: In the misty mountain strongholds of the southern Mexico state of Chiapas, ski mask-clad members and supporters of the Zapatista rebel movement gathered to mark the 20th anniversary of a New Year's uprising that wrenched the world's attention to the plight of the country's impoverished and oft-ignored indigenous.

headline.main: Mexico's Zapatista Rebel Movement Marks 20 Years

docs.snippet: Some classes never met and some grades were illicitly changed in a University of North Carolina department that attracted numerous athletes, and a respected professor now faces a criminal charge....
docs.lead_paragraph: Some classes never met and some grades were illicitly changed in a University of North Carolina department that attracted numerous athletes, and a respected professor now faces a criminal charge.
docs.abstract: University of North Carolina and law-enforcement officials report that some classes that attracted numerous athletes never met, and some grades in those classes were illicitly changed; indictment handed up by Orange County, NC, jury charges Prof Julius Nyang'oro, internationally respected scholar, with fraud; critics say it covers just a small piece of one of the biggest cases of academic fraud in the state's history.

headline.main: A’s for Athletes, but Charges of Fraud at North Carolina
headline.print_headline: A’s for Athletes, but Charges of Tar Heel Fraud

docs.snippet: As of Dec. 30, the city had reported 413 homicides, about a 17 percent drop from the year before and the fewest to date since 1965....
docs.lead_paragraph: As of Dec. 30, the city had reported 413 homicides, about a 17 percent drop from the year before and the fewest to date since 1965.
docs.abstract: Chicago's homicides in 2013 dropped 17 percent from 2012, fewest to date since 1965; reports in crimes over all dropped by 16 percent; officials in the administration of Mayor Rahm Emanuel, who has faced scrutiny over his handling of violence, say drop is result of an array of efforts, from new police tactics to after-school and summer programs.

headline.main: Chicago Killings Fall, as Officials Praise Progress
headline.print_headline: Chicago Killings Fall, as Officials Praise Progress
